node.title: Jeongyeong's baby girl is the 'most beautiful decision' he's made. But he still hasn't met her
node.alt: A young Korean male and female smiling on a train.
node.description: Jeongyeong's first child, a baby girl, was born in August last year. But he's never been able to hold her, and temporary residents like his wife are left in limbo as Australia's borders reopen.
node.content:
["Jeongyeong Lee and his wife Sunhee Han have put a lot of thought into their first-born daughter's name.\u00a0", "Her English name is Honey, but her Korean name is Nagyeol Lee \u2014\u00a0Na means \"beautiful\" and Gyeol means \"decision\", Mr Lee said.", "\"She is literally our most beautiful decision,\" he told the ABC.", "But Mr Lee has never been able to hold her in his arms.", "\"It's almost\u00a0one and half years, and I've never seen\u00a0my baby.\"", "The couple moved to Australia about five years ago and felt an affinity with Tasmania's lush natural landscape and its \"very kind\" people, so they decided to make it their home.", "", "
Baby Nagyeol was born in Korea in August 2020.(Supplied)
", "At the start of the pandemic, they thought it would be best for Ms Han to return to South Korea to give birth \u2014\u00a0COVID-19 had impacted their finances, and she could be cared for by her family there.", "But like many couples, they could not foresee how long international border closures would keep them apart.", "He watched his wife's body change during her pregnancy over Facetime and their daughter was born in August 2020.", "\"I still remember that day my baby was born, I was big crying,\" he said.", "\"I can see my baby growing [on] Facetime. She is really growing fast.", "Mr Lee works as a chef at a Sandy Bay caf\u00e9 in Hobart's south. He and his wife both have temporary 485 visas and they hope to apply for permanent residency once she is able to return.", "He was initially happy when news broke that the border would reopen for international travel, but temporary residents like his wife have been left out of Australia's reopening plan.", "For now, overseas citizens and permanent residents can return to some Australian states and territories without having to quarantine if they are\u00a0fully vaccinated.", "But temporary residents must have an exemption to travel.", "", "
The couple could not imagine how long border closures would keep them apart.(Supplied)
", "\"It's hard to explain my feelings \u2026 I still feel guilty for my family,\" Mr Lee said.", "For now, he is trying to do what he can to build a life for his young family, staying positive and hoping that he can be reunited with his wife and child as soon as possible.", "A statement from the Australian Border Force, which did not comment on Ms Han's individual case, said the government \"continues to plan to reopen our borders to fully vaccinated skilled workers and international students in the near future, with international tourists to follow\", but did not provide a timeline.", "\"All foreign nationals who are not automatically exempt from Australia's travel restrictions must obtain an exemption prior to travel,\"\u00a0the spokesperson said.", "\"Grounds for seeking an exemption include individuals who provide critical skills or can demonstrate compelling and compassionate circumstances.\"", "
'A Love Actually moment'
", "Cheryl Rippon-Dootson and her wife Lea are excited for their daughter to finally meet her UK-based grandparents next month.", "Their daughter Skylar will turn two in January.", "", "
This year the young family are looking forward to taking a big family Christmas photo in the UK.
", "\"It's time that you can't get back. They've missed so many milestones.\"", "Ms Rippon-Dootson's parents were planning to come to Melbourne in March of 2020 to help out, but then the pandemic hit.", "", "
Cheryl\u00a0Rippon-Dootson, right, with her wife Lea and their daughter Skylar, shortly after she was born.(Supplied)
", "With international travel restrictions now easing, the trio booked a flight (and re-booked it after it was suddenly cancelled) to the UK just before Christmas.", "\"I actually cried to the [travel] agents on the phone, just in pure relief that I was going to still be able to get there,\" she said.", "", "
Skylar is almost two and has lived most of her life in and out of Melbourne's lockdowns.(Supplied)
", "Ms Rippon-Dootson, who recently became an Australian citizen but is originally from Liverpool, said she had\u00a0been trying not to get her hopes too high \u2014\u00a0with COVID rules having shifted the goal posts multiple times.", "But the excitement is building for a family Christmas and celebrating Skylar's second birthday together.", "Ms Rippon-Dootson\u00a0especially cannot wait for her father to meet her daughter.", "\"[There are] so many mannerisms of his that she has, and yet she has never met him in person,\" she said.", "
First steps and missed milestones
", "Victorian grandmother Kerrie Clarence counts herself luckier than many, but she is\u00a0still making up for lost time.", "\"I really wanted to be a nana for a long time,\" she said, adding she had been secretly amassing a stash of baby clothes and toys ever since her son got married.", "", "
\"In my own biased opinion, he is one of the two most gorgeous children ever to grace this world,\" Kerrie Clarence says of her grandson Austin.(Supplied)
", "She was able to meet her first grandson, Austin, who was born in December 2019 in Adelaide, before the pandemic.", "Then when her granddaughter Annabelle was born in April this year, there was a window of relaxed travel between states, so she was fortunate to meet her too.", "But after missing much of their young lives, she is counting down the days until she can be reunited with them at the end of this month.", "\"They grow and change so fast in those first months that we will be getting to know them all over again,\" she said.", "Although they missed Austin's first birthday, she \"got one really good milestone\" when she visited shortly after.", "\"We have missed just about everything else, but that was something I'm going to always hold on to.\"", "Ms Clarence has been able to have breakfast via video call with her grandkids every day \u2014\u00a0another thing she is grateful for, although it is no substitute for the real thing.", "\"You don't get to cuddle them, you don't get to really get to know them \u2026 I haven't been able to babysit them,\" she said.", "\"Sometimes we'll be videoing and I'll just burst into tears, because I just want to be with them.", "\"It's very hard to see them and not be able to touch them.\"", "It is\u00a0an experience she knows is not unique, and it is\u00a0one that is fundamentally reshaping people's priorities.", "\"It's affecting people in very real ways. Apart from just being sad, it's affecting where they want to live,\" she said."]
